Two astral skiffs, each carrying half of group
Astral brig carrying entire group plus an additional 30 {@creature githyanki warrior||githyanki warriors}
Planar raider carrying entire group plus an additional 60 {@creature githyanki warrior||githyanki warriors}
table.name: Githyanki Raiding Parties; Raiding Party Transport

table.caption: Githyanki Purpose of Raid
rows: Wanton destruction, the githyanki want to fight and loot to relieve their boredom
Revenge, the githyanki seek a stolen silver sword
Mind flayer hunt, the githyanki are seeking mind flayers and their thralls
Vlaakith's orders, the githyanki have been dispatched to seize a specific item or person
table.name: Githyanki Raiding Parties; Githyanki Purpose of Raid

table.caption: Githzerai Mission Purpose
rows: Hunting a specific mind flayer colony
Seeking news on mind flayer activity
On a training mission, seeking to hone their skills and learn of the world
Seek to ally with party on a raid against mind flayers
table.name: Githzerai Groups; Githzerai Mission Purpose

table.caption: Halfling Personality Traits
rows: You try to start every day with a smile.
Why walk when you can skip?
You make up songs about your friends that praise them for their bravery and intelligence.
You are extremely cautious, always on the lookout for monsters and other dangers.
You always see the bright side of a situation.
You like to collect mementos of your travels.
table.name: Halfling Tables; Halfling Personality Traits

table.caption: Halfling Ideals
rows: Courage. You seek to prove that the bravest heart can be contained within the smallest of packages.
Companionship. You're pretty sure you can be friends with anyone or anything.
Hopeful. You will live a life of adventure and have many stories to tell.
Protective. You make sure to shelter the innocent.
Honest. Your mother told you to always tell the truth.
Excitement. Can you steal the sleeping giant's pouch? Of course you can!
table.name: Halfling Tables; Halfling Ideals

table.caption: Halfling Bonds
rows: The safety of your village is worth any sacrifice.
Nothing is more valuable than friendship and family.
You are following your own path through life. No one can tell you what to do.
You have a special heirloom that you never part with.
You won't rob or hurt those who are weaker or less fortunate than you.
No matter how small you may be, you won't back down from a bully.
table.name: Halfling Tables; Halfling Bonds

table.caption: Halfling Flaws
rows: You can't resist poking your nose where it doesn't belong.
You are very fidgety. Sitting still is a major challenge.
You can't pass up a good time.
You hate to miss a meal, and become grumpy and illtempered when you must.
You are fascinated by shiny things and can't help "borrowing" them.
You never settle for just one slice when you can have the whole cake.
table.name: Halfling Tables; Halfling Flaws

table.caption: Reasons for Adventuring
rows: Peeling taters and herding goats all the time wasn't your cup of tea.
You fell asleep on a raft one day and woke up near a human city. You were so thrilled with the strange sights and tasty food that you never turned back.
What started off as simple pumpkin pillaging from nearby farms turned into your becoming a wandering rogue for hire.
You talked to a nice faerie in the woods, and all of a sudden you were a thousand miles from home.
Your village elder told you so many stories about being a rogue in an adventuring party that you couldn't resist the urge to try doing it yourself.
A friend dared you to jump on the back of a sleeping horse, which turned out to be a pegasus, and your life hasn't slowed down since.
table.name: Halfling Tables; Reasons for Adventuring

table.caption: Gnome Deities
rows: Golden signet ring with six pointed star
footnotes: *Appears in {@i Xanathar's Guide to Everything}
**Appears in {@i Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide}
table.name: Gnome Gods; Gnome Deities

table.caption: Gnome Personality Traits
rows: Once you develop a liking for something, you quickly become obsessed with it.
You live life like a leaf on the breeze, letting it take you where it will.
The world is a miraculous place, and you are fascinated by everything in it.
You study your friends and take notes about how they act, jotting down things they say that interest you.
Your curiosity is so wide-ranging that you sometimes have trouble concentrating on any one thing.
You like to make little objects and creatures out of twigs or bits of metal and give them to friends.
table.name: Gnome Tables; Gnome Personality Traits

table.caption: Gnome Ideals
rows: Love. You love little (and big) critters and go out of your way to help them.
Curiosity. You can't stand an unsolved mystery or an unopened door.
Knowledge. You are interested in everything. You never know when what you learn will come in handy.
Compassion. You never turn down a plea for help.
Helpfulness. Whether you see a broken contraption or a broken heart, you have to try to fix it.
Excellence. You strive to be and do the best you can.
table.name: Gnome Tables; Gnome Ideals

table.caption: Gnome Bonds
rows: You pledge to bring something of immense value back to your burrow.
Anything of great quality and artisanship is to be protected, respected, and cared for.
Kobolds have caused you and your people nothing but trouble. You will avenge those wrongs.
You are searching for your lost love.
You will recover a keepsake stolen from your clan.
You are willing to take risks to learn about the world.
table.name: Gnome Tables; Gnome Bonds

table.caption: Gnome Flaws
rows: You embody the typical absent-minded professor. If you could forget where you put your head, you would.
You prefer to hide during a fight.
There is no difference between what you think and what you say.
table.name: Gnome Tables; Gnome Flaws

table.caption: Suggested Ideals
rows: {@b Nation.} I am devoted to the restoration of Benalia's empire.
{@b Peace.} Life can truly thrive only when war and strife are stilled.
{@b Protection.} I will also protect the less fortunate from the depredations of the rich and strong.
{@b Hope.} The world is emerging from a long despair, and needs every shred of inspiration we can offer.
{@b Honor.} If I dishonor myself, I bring dishonor on my deity, my nation, and my family.
{@b Solidarity.} Together, we are stronger than any of us alone.
table.name: Heroes of Benalia; Suggested Ideals

table.caption: Suggested Bonds
rows: I am connected to one of the Seven Great Houses, and I place its interests above all others.
I have closer ties among my Star-Clan than in my blood family.
I own a weapon or a piece of armor used by a renowned ancestor.
I am in love with a member of a different great house.
I believe I am the last heir of a great house that was lost.
My family's estate lies in ruins, and I want to rebuild it.
table.name: Heroes of Benalia; Suggested Bonds

table.caption: Benalish Quests
rows: Defend a mining settlement in the Red Iron Mountains from the raids of Crookshank kobolds.
Establish trade or negotiate a treaty with minotaurs in the Hurloon Mountains.
{@action Help} settle a dispute between two of the Great Houses.
Convince the Council of Seven to send military aid to one of the seven houses.
Establish a trading colony in an inhospitable land.
Uncover a traitor or Cabal cultist among the Seven Great Houses.
table.name: Benalish Quests

table.caption: Benalish Sites
rows: A lost Sheoltun temple of the state-sponsored Church of Angelfire
A hidden mountain cave holding an ancient Thran relic
A secret subbasement deep under New Benalia, which once served as a meeting place for the outlawed Church of Serra during the Sheoltun Empire's reign
A wrecked Phyrexian portal-ship, long overgrown by nature
The remains of a castle that sank in a mire during the Years of Salt
The top of a tower in Benalia City
An open field dotted with ruins left behind by long-ago war
A shipwreck just off the coast
An abandoned mansion in the Caligo Morass
A Serran cathedral fallen to the ground from its place in the sky
table.name: Benalish Sites

table.caption: Benalish Villains
rows: A zealous warrior wants to lead an army to war against Keld.
A house leader wants their house to be the Highest House several years ahead of schedule.
A suspicious noble joins forces with a fiery Serran priest to try to root out corruption and the taint of the Cabal from the populace, with many innocents getting hurt in the process.
A hotheaded aven demands that their people gain immediate representation on the Council of Seven.
A pious noble seeks to bring the entire Church of Serra under Benalish control, combining church and state into a theocratic empire.
One member of the Council of Seven has a long-standing grudge against another.
A skin-witch of the Caligo Morass brings a nearby area under a curse.
An important noble has fallen under the influence of an advisor with ties to the Cabal, and is advancing the Cabal's plans without knowing it.
table.name: Benalish Villains

table.caption: Suggested Ideals
rows: {@b Law.} "Law must be upheld. If the knots of order are loosened, chaos will spill through." (Song of All, Canto 167)
{@b Grace.} "Grace must be preserved. If the strands of Grace are unraveled, its design will be lost, and the people with it." (Song of All, Canto 167)
{@b Duty.} "Duty must be obeyed. If the frame of Duty is broken, none shall weave life's fabric." (Song of All, Canto 167)
{@b Reason.} "Reason must be retained. If the web of Reason comes unwoven, madness will escape." (Song of All, Canto 167)
{@b Truth.} "Truth must be set free. If the wings of Truth are clipped, the voices will fall silent." (Song of All, Canto 167)
{@b The Four Virtues.} Art, discourse, freedom, and peace are the life of the spirit, as the spirit is the life of the body.
table.name: Heroes of Serra; Suggested Ideals

table.caption: Suggested Bonds
rows: I would do anything to protect the Cathedral of Serra at Sursi.
I have sworn to aid Lyra Dawnbringer in protecting Benalia.
I make regular pilgrimages to the Temple of Serra at Epityr in New Argive, the oldest active Serran worship site in the world.
I preserve many of the old traditions of the Daru nomads or the aven, revering Serra as the Ancestor.
A lesser angel has become a close friend and confidante to me.
I think the stained glass in my holy symbol came from Serra's Realm before that artificial plane's collapse. Invoke the Divine Magali Villeneuve
table.name: Heroes of Serra; Suggested Bonds

table.caption: Serran Quests
rows: Act as an impartial mediator between Benalia and Keld (or two other powers of the region).
Tame a mesa pegasus from the lands of Sursi on the east coast of southern Aerona, near the great Cathedral of Serra.
Protect a peaceful community of Serran monks who have come under attack (from without or within).
Answer the call of a barbarian chieftain who wants to hear the message of Serra and consider conversion.
Find an angel who has disappeared in a dangerous land.
Retrieve as much artwork as possible from a ruined Serran church—whether an ancient site or one that was only recently destroyed.
table.name: Serran Quests

table.caption: Serran Sites
rows: A majestic Serran cathedral floating in the air (perhaps above Benalia City)
A small monastery surrounded by pastoral farmland or quiet woods
A remote temple maintained and inhabited by an order of knights
An ancient ruin preserving some foreign aspect of Serra worship (such as Otarian devotion to the Ancestor)
A sacred cave where a new angel was (or is about to be) birthed
An abandoned missionary post destroyed by hostile natives of the area
A chapel within a castle or palace beset by intrigue
A roadside shrine where miracles have occurred lately
A community devoted to the spiritual path of the artistic life
The scorched site of an angel's death
table.name: Serran Sites

table.caption: Serran Villains
rows: A Serran priest believes that no one is beyond redemption, and is shielding a murderous villain from the law in the hope that they will repent.
A naive angel keeps sending Serran knights on deadly quests against impossible odds.
An aven priest wants to lead other aven away from the Serran church and revive the worship of the Ancestor, but without the accretion of Serran tradition.
A warrior chieftain claims to have converted to Serra worship and launches a crusade in the church's name—but this is a thinly veiled excuse to conquer a neighboring territory.
A Serra angel has been corrupted by the demonic power of the Cabal.
A community of Serran monks has been somehow led astray into the contemplation of an ancient, nameless evil.
An old priest grows bitter with grief and frustration, convinced that their life's work has been a waste—and turns to the pursuit of revenge.
A priest twists the teachings of Serra to paint a certain group of innocent people as evil, and to call for their extermination.
table.name: Serran Villains

table.caption: Suggested Ideals
colLabels: Ideal 1 Teaching. Tolaria is a school where the world's most promising wizards can learn from masters of their craft.
rows: {@b Restoration.} Every day, lost knowledge is regained and devastated lands are renewed. It's our duty to use our magic to help this effort continue.
{@b Responsibility.} Following the philosophy of the Academy's original headmaster, Barrin, I am dedicated to keeping powerful magic out of the hands of those who would abuse it.
{@b Innovation.} Like the ancient artificer Urza, I believe progress comes through bold and radical new design.
{@b Progress.} Like the kind Tolarian chancellor Rayne, I believe progress comes through careful iteration and measured experimentation.
{@b Self-Improvement.} Like Urza's brother Mishra, I believe that the improvement of the body through genetic and artificial modification leads to the general improvement of humanity.
table.name: Heroes of Tolaria; Suggested Ideals

table.caption: Suggested Bonds
rows: I have a former student I'm convinced will do great things—for good or for evil.
I bought a cheap curio from a secondhand store, and I was expelled when it caused a magical accident.
I've gotten tangled up with illegal research by way of the Shadow Academy, which uses interdimensional spaces to facilitate communication.
By virtue of a parent who is emeritus faculty, I have the rare privilege of citizenship in one of the Academies.
One of my old teachers has a knack for contacting me at the strangest times.
I believe that my genetic makeup was manipulated for some unknown purpose.
table.name: Heroes of Tolaria; Suggested Bonds

table.caption: Tolarian Quests
rows: Retrieve a unique magical device from the ruins of a catastrophe—but be careful, because the device might well have been what caused the catastrophe.
Copy a spell from the spellbook of a mysterious or hostile wizard.
Find a way to reverse the effect of a disastrous magical experiment.
Decide what to do with a notebook you found, which is full of forbidden research into Phyrexian transformation.
Steal a magical object that's on display in a museum on campus in order to uncover its secrets or harness the energy it holds.
Try to reproduce the research of a wizard who has gone missing, without ending up missing yourself.
table.name: Tolarian Quests

table.caption: Tolarian Sites
rows: An underwater ruin left behind by a terrible catastrophe
The trap-filled tower of an eccentric, suspicious, and powerful wizard
An arcane workshop or laboratory filled with inexplicable and undoubtedly dangerous devices
A laboratory where research was once conducted—or still is conducted—on living monsters
A small stronghold drifting through the air or across the ocean
A library hidden in an extradimensional space
An ancient Phyrexian or Thran artifact, now overgrown by nature
A crater where a meteorite or a flying vessel crashed to the ground centuries ago
A newly discovered ruin from an ancient era of advanced magical technology
An area that has just returned after being phased out of the flow of time
table.name: Tolarian Sites

table.caption: Tolarian Villains
rows: A member of the Society of Mishra seeks to be transformed into a biomechanical demon of fused metal and flesh.
A Gathist involved in illegal genetic experimentation seeks to create a race of supersoldiers to forge a nation through conquest.
A collector steals magical items and treats them like valuable works of art.
A professor of temporal studies seeks to hasten the process of rebirth and renewal—by shifting the entire world backward in time to its "glory days."
An archaeologist has discovered an ancient magical weapon that caused untold devastation, and is trying to find a use for it.
A professor has imprisoned students in a tower and compelled them to participate in genetic, biomechanical, psychological, or other research.
An artificer built a golem that has achieved its own evil consciousness, and which seeks to better understand living creatures through vivisection.
A misguided master wizard is trying to trace a single "true Tolarian ancestry," so as to prevent those who don't belong to that human bloodline from entering the Academies and studying magic.
table.name: Tolarian Villains

table.caption: Vodalian Quests
rows: Retrieve an artifact from ancient Vodalia that is kept in a Tolarian museum.
Sabotage a Cabal port on Walassa, where ships set sail for Aerona carrying Cabal cultists.
Protect a peripatetic member of the Society of the Conch on a journey to learn about your native culture.
Defend a surface port loyal to Vodalia from a land-based attack.
Find a pirate captain who slaughtered a group of merfolk, but who has not been seen in the Voda Sea since.
Retrieve an item of historical significance from a Keldon fortress.
table.name: Vodalian Quests

table.caption: Vodalian Sites
rows: A shipwreck on the ocean floor
A surface-built city that sank in a magical catastrophe
A city built on the back of an enormous leviathan
A palace in a coral reef
A ship crossing the Voda Sea
A well-preserved Thran or Phyrexian artifact deep underwater
A sea cave on an island shore
A beach where merfolk trade with surface-dwellers
table.name: Vodalian Sites

table.caption: Vodalian Villains
rows: A hotheaded young military officer, part of the Akula Current, plans to escalate conflict with a surface port in hopes of eventually annexing the port.
A notable aristocrat decides that no ships may cross their territory—and sinks a merchant vessel to emphasize the point.
A mage manipulates coastal waters, causing saltwater to back up rivers, beachfront land to flood, and docks to be swept away by the waves.
A group of merfolk turn to piracy, angering both surface-dwellers and other merfolk.
A trickster lures sailors into shipwrecks, then either takes them captive or watches them drown.
A spellcaster calls up horrific monsters from the ocean depths to attack a coastal town.
A general's crusade against homarids is driving those creatures into human-occupied coastal lands.
A wizard seeks the Golgothian Sylex—the artifact that destroyed the island of Argoth and launched the ice age—in hopes of destroying all land on Dominaria.
table.name: Vodalian Villains

table.caption: Cabal Sites
rows: A small shrine to Belzenlok located near a major city
A basement room in a busy town where Cabal cultists meet
A ruined library that cultists are excavating, hoping to find magic items to decorate Belzenlok's throne
A half-collapsed temple in a dark swamp
An ancient war machine whose power the Cabal is trying to harness
A small outpost of Grimnant knights
A deep sinkhole with whispering echoes emerging from the darkness
A secret fortress in the mountains
The house of an aristocrat who has joined the Cabal
table.name: Cabal Sites

table.caption: Cabal Villains
rows: A Grimnant commander leads raids along a nation's borders to sow chaos and confusion.
A Cabal assassin starts killing the firstborn children of prominent families.
A dementist unleashes formless horrors of nightmare upon a defenseless town.
A cult leader sends a miasma out from a hidden temple to pollute and corrupt the surrounding forest.
A Cabal cultist has infiltrated a ruling council or prominent church body and begins destroying it from within.
A dementist is controlling the mind of a monster, sending it to rampage through an area of farms and villages.
A Cabal infiltrator sows discord among various factions within a larger organization (different Serran orders, different Benalish houses, and so forth).
Cabal infiltrators detonate nightmare devices designed to cause as much terror as possible, striking in highly populated areas at unpredictable times.
table.name: Cabal Villains

table.caption: Suggested Ideals
rows: {@b Self-Reliance.} I don't wear or use anything I haven't made myself. You can't count on anyone else in this world.
{@b Future.} I believe a true Twilight still awaits the Keldon faithful, when our fallen heroes will rise up to fight alongside us as we conquer the world.
{@b Pragmatism.} No ancestors are coming to save us—we are our only hope.
{@b Coin.} I will happily fight for those too weak to defend themselves, if they pay me enough.
{@b Freedom.} The so-called "new Keld" is too safe, too controlled. The fire in Keldon blood demands warfare and pillage.
{@b Keld.} I am Keldon, and that is all that matters. I seek the glory and prosperity of my people above all else.
table.name: Bard or Cleric; Suggested Ideals

table.caption: Suggested Bonds
rows: I fight to prove myself worthy of my glorious ancestors.
Even away from Keld, my loyalty is to my warlord and the rest of my warhost.
I'm inexplicably drawn to the sacred peak called the Mountain.
My favorite weapon is one I forged from the broken weapons of my enemies.
I want to be a warlord someday, and I won't stop there.
I had a dear mentor from another nation who taught me my skills.
table.name: Bard or Cleric; Suggested Bonds

table.caption: Keld Quests
rows: Persuade a Benalish house to abandon a colony newly established on Keld's soil.
Carry an urgent message from one warlord to another across a dangerous area.
Convince a wayward warlord to obey an overseer's orders before the situation escalates into full-on rebellion.
Undermine the loyalty of a rebellious warlord's warhost, thus depriving the warlord of power.
Kill a monster lurking in the mountains.
Fend off attacks by frost giants from the north.
table.name: Keld Quests

table.caption: Keld Sites
rows: At the foot of the Keldons' sacred Mountain
At the entrance to the Keldon Necropolis, where great figures of the past are interred
A tower formed from strange black ice
A forest clearing where the air is cold enough to freeze your breath in your mouth
A plateau where carved megaliths are erected
A camp with dozens of round tents
At the peak of the Keldons' sacred Mountain
table.name: Keld Sites

table.caption: Keld Villains
rows: A warlord leads an attack on a different warhost.
A doyen advises several different warlords to provoke conflicts with Benalia, believing that a full-scale war will trigger the true Twilight.
A shaman has secretly made an alliance with the frost giants of the northern wastes to help overthrow the grand warlord.
A shaman dabbles in the hated arts of necromancy, hoping to reproduce the false Twilight caused by the Phrexians.
A frost giant shaman brings a nightmarish winter down over Keld, and it begins spreading farther south.
A warlord leads a host in longboats to the Benalish isle of Avenant.
A warlord directly challenges the authority of the grand warlord, hoping to take her place.
A warlord kills the grand warlord and starts transforming Keld back into the land of bloodthirsty raiders it once was.
table.name: Keld Villains

table.caption: Suggested Ideals
rows: {@b Riashil Pacifism.} To live at peace with nature, we must first learn to live at peace with each other.
{@b Staprion Defiance.} Those who cross lines must be put in their place.
{@b Loridalh Interdependence.} I am my own master, but I am strongest when I work as part of the web of all life.
{@b Kelfae Flexibility.} The search for stability—whether in a swaying treetop or in the turmoil of life—is fruitless.
{@b Jubilar Remembrance.} The sacrifice of those who were exterminated in the Phyrexian Invasion must be remembered, and their stories retold.
{@b Basiphem Pride.} Because we are strong, it is our responsibility to aid the rest of the forest where we can.
{@b Hedressel Holiness.} We must maintain our distance—culturally and physically—from other peoples to maintain our connections to the wood.
{@b Ruadach Openness.} We must open ourselves to new cultures, new peoples, and new ideas, or we will rot like a fallen log.
table.name: Fighter or Ranger; Suggested Ideals

table.caption: Suggested Bonds
rows: I could always count on my mother to give me a good bonk on the head if I did something foolish. (Riashil)
I will have my revenge against the Cabal for the harm they have done to my kin. (Staprion)
One of the twelve tallest emergent trees in Llanowar is the dearest place to me in all the world. (Loridalh)
I was bonded to a kavu at birth. (Kelfae)
I survived the Phyrexian Invasion over three hundred years ago, and I will never forget the faces of those who died. (Jubilar)
My family carries the shame of failing to protect Llanowar from the Phyrexian Invasion, and I will stop at nothing to undo that shame. (Basiphem)
I spent a year in Hedressel, and I would give my life to defend that holy place. (Hedressel)
I left my family rather than endure the grief of losing them. (Ruadach)
table.name: Fighter or Ranger; Suggested Bonds

table.caption: Llanowar Quests
rows: Find the source of orc raids in the Ironcrown Mountains.
Retrieve something caught in the web of an enormous spider.
Carry a message to a Benalish city—about diplomacy, trade, matters of the heart, or anything else.
Track down an interloper who managed to escape punishment for crimes against the forest (perhaps even trespassing in Hedressel).
Dispose of a newly uncovered piece of Phyrexian wreckage.
Plant a seed from Llanowar in the Whispering Woods or another distant forest.
table.name: Llanowar Quests

table.caption: Llanowar Sites
rows: Inside a giant tree that has strangely begun to rot from the inside
At the top of an emergent tree, where magical flowers grow
Nestled among the roots of one of the oldest and largest trees in the forest
A temple hollowed out from a huge branch of a still-living tree
A statue of the elf hero Eladamri, situated in the middle of a placid forest clearing
A network of rope bridges connecting canopy trees
A sinister-looking tower made from a dead tree
An enormous patch of mushrooms that gets larger every day
An anthill, termite nest, or wasp nest that's larger than a grand temple
table.name: Llanowar Sites

table.caption: Llanowar Villains
rows: A zealous druid wants to drive the humans and half-elves out of Ruadach.
A pragmatist thinks the old druidic traditions are holding the elves back from greatness, and seeks to destroy Hedressel or Molimo (or both).
A knight of the Steel Leaf tries to stir up war with Benalia, in order to have an excuse to slaughter the humans.
A druid uses ancient necromancy to poison a stream supplying water to a Benalish town.
A Staprion warrior believes the pacifist Riashil are traitors to the elves, and tries to goad them into fighting.
An elf has bred a giant kavu intended to topple trees and destroy elfhames.
A necromancer wants to use the spirits of the elven dead that are said to guard Hedressel to destroy the elves entirely.
A leader of the Order of the Steel Leaf is in league with the Cabal, and tries to undermine the Staprion offensive against that order.
table.name: Llanowar Villains

table.caption: Ravnica Currency
table.name: Currency: Zibs and Zinos; Ravnica Currency

table.caption: Party Makeup
rows: {@b One-Guild Party}. Kies een gilde en raadpleeg de beschrijving in {@book chapter 2|GGR|2} voor suggesties over het bouwen van de partij eromheen.
{@b Classic Party}. Boros of Selesnya cleric (Life Domain), Azorius of Boros fighter (Champion archetype), Dimir of Golgari rogue (Thief archetype), Boros of Izzet wizard (School of Evocation)
{@b Law and Order Party}. Boros cleric, Azorius fighter, Azorius wizard, Boros ranger
{@b Mad Science Party}. Simic druïde, Izzet vechter, Izzet tovenaar, Simic monnik
{@b Skulkers Party}. Golgari druïde, Golgari vechter of ranger, Dimir rogue of monnik, Dimir tovenaar
{@b Chaos Party}. Gruul druïde, Gruul barbaar, {@creature Rakdos|GGR} tovenaar, {@creature Rakdos|GGR} Rogue
{@b Nature Party}. Selesnya druïde, Gruul barbaar, Simic tovenaar of Selesnya bard, Golgari rogue
{@b Benevolent Party}. Cleric voltooid, Boros paladin, Azorius tovenaar, Bard voltooid
table.name: Building a Party; Party Makeup

table.caption: Common Cause
rows: {@b Cellmates}. De personages zijn gevangenen in een Azorius-gevangenis, een Gruul-kamp, of een {@creature Rakdos|GGR} kooi.
{@b Greater Threat}. De personages zijn met elkaar in gevecht als een razende wurm aanvalt.
{@b Sudden Danger}. De personages zitten samen gevangen door een sinkhole dat opengaat, een gebouw dat instort, of een laboratorium dat explodeert.
{@b Dream Team}. Een vreemde droom leidt elk personage naar dezelfde bestemming.
{@b Lost Together}. De personages zijn hopeloos verdwaald in een onbekend deel van de stad.
{@b Detente}. In opdracht van de leiders van hun gilden, moeten de personages samenwerken om een geheime missie te voltooien.
{@b Common Foe}. Een schurk is een gemeenschappelijke vijand van alle personages.
{@b Do or Die}. De personages proberen allemaal de catastrofe van een totale oorlog tussen de gilden af te wenden.
table.name: Building a Party; Common Cause

table.caption: People on the Street—Precinct One
rows: Banker, heading to a favorite restaurant
Diplomat, heading to the Chamber of the Guildpact
Ghost, looking for directions to Orzhova
Government official, late for an appointment
Jeweler, heading to a grooming salon
Opera singer, enjoying a meal outside
Painter, working on a street scene
table.name: People on the Street—Precinct One

table.caption: Rumors—Precinct One
rows: "Oh, dear! Did you hear all that commotion yesterday evening near the opera house? It appears that a couple of dignitaries went missing during the performance."
"I hear that Nolson has purses and handbags in his inventory that bear some sort of magic. They'll get snapped up quickly, I'll wager."
"A most dreadful moaning was coming from the plaza today. My friend said she saw a wailing spirit floating over the park. I wish they'd stay in the bank."
"Such a commotion at the Wayfinder Club last night. I heard the fight, but a friend told me there were blades drawn, and the perpetrator escaped!"
"Can you believe the gall of some people? I saw a couple of dirty ruffians in my neighborhood last night, and they were defacing the walls of the courthouse!"
"I still can't believe that crazy old Orzhov syndic just handing out zinos near the plaza, muttering 'The end is near.' She'll invite nothing but undesirables sniffing for free coin."
table.name: Rumors—Precinct One

table.caption: People on the Street—Precinct Two
rows: Arrester, off duty and out buying produce
Arrester, on duty and watching for trouble
Baker, returning from a long work shift
Carpenter, searching for a good pack animal
Chandler, fuming after a recent argument
Government official, enjoying a day off
Locksmith, on the way to unlock a door
Retired soldier, heading to a chess game
Shopkeeper, taking a child out for a treat
Teenager, heading to a friend's house
Tourist, heading to the Millennial Platform
table.name: People on the Street—Precinct Two

table.caption: Rumors—Precinct Two
rows: "Can you believe the deals that Janus has this week in his shop? I wonder if he's in trouble, trying to move his merchandise so quickly."
"I got a tip on some high-quality blades at Minera's. She's looking to find good homes for them, and she says some are enchanted."
"Two Boros minotaurs garrisoned at Sunhome were meeting with old friends at Newson's Tavern last night. They spent most of the night telling stories about a madness taking hold of their ranks."
"An airship docked in the middle of the night at Augustin Station without any people on board. No one knows how it got there without a crew."
"This is the third person gone missing in Griffin Heights this week. I hear they were all gamblers and deep in it. Must've owed way too much."
"Did you hear about that lawmage who went crazy? They had to send two squads of arresters to bring him down. He kept telling them 'A homunculus made me do it.' I don't want to know what 'it' is."
table.name: Rumors—Precinct Two

table.caption: People on the Street—Precinct Three
rows: Beast trainer, walking an animal on a leash
Centaur, out to get the family some food
Evangelist, trying to win Selesnya converts
Farmer, using a healing balm after a hard day
Guide, taking a wolf out for a stroll
Healer, on the way to tend to someone sick
Pilgrim, looking for directions to Vitu-Ghazi
Storyteller, practicing oration out on the street
Teamster, carrying a broken wagon wheel
table.name: People on the Street—Precinct Three

table.caption: Rumors—Precinct Three
rows: "Something keeps spooking the pack animals. I wonder what it could be?"
"I hear there's an old granary in the rubblebelt that's filled with bandit plunder. Probably worth a peek!"
"The giant spiders above Velen's Rest have become aggressive as of late. I heard someone got poisoned by one yesterday."
"Can you believe they're going to close Vitu-Ghazi to visitors tomorrow? I wonder what's going on."
"Those rumblings that shook the ground last night were definitely wurms tunneling. I'm sure the Selesnya aren't pleased."
"We should go find that loxodon priest and see if she's still having visions. I'll bet we can get her to tell us our future!"
table.name: Rumors—Precinct Three

table.caption: People on the Street—Precinct Four
rows: Bounty hunter, asking about a mark
Displaced merchant, looking for a new home
Soldier, on duty and eating a quick bite
Soldier, off duty and fixing his armor
Thrill seeker, hoping to see some Gruul raiders
Transient, looking for a good place to sleep
table.name: People on the Street—Precinct Four

table.caption: Rumors—Precinct Four
rows: "Sergeant Uwen got hold of something even the war wurms of the Gruul fear. Don't know what it is, but he sent one of them running just by standing there."
"If you're looking for the best deals on explosives, you should talk to one of the Shattergang Brothers. They'll set you up right, no questions asked."
"I swear I saw {@creature Niv-Mizzet|GGR}'s head floating above Nivix last night. I wonder what it means."
"Beria over on Tin Street just put out some new curiosities. Says they came from an expedition in the undercity. Could be magical."
"My whole street's been smelling like sulfur for the past two days now. People are starting to get sick, and the soldiers don't take it seriously."
"I saw an angel and a demon having what looked like a polite conversation. I couldn't believe my eyes!"
table.name: Rumors—Precinct Four

table.caption: People on the Street—Precinct Five
rows: Barkeep, picking up some dropped coins
Tinker, out of breath from running
Vampire mind drinker, heading to the library
table.name: People on the Street—Precinct Five

table.caption: Rumors—Precinct Five
rows: "The latest is that the translocation device is only operating within fifty percent of tolerances. I'm certain that funding will be pulled any day now."
"I don't know how Zameck does it, but they've certainly built a better soldier. And I hear some of the formulas have made it outside their halls."
"That ghost haunting the history section of the Ismeri Library is back. I've heard this time it can speak, and it's looking for someone."
"Creatures of some sort of elemental composition were emerging from the Blistercoils this morning. Those things could be anywhere in the city by now."
"I can't believe Professor Zagany let her see his research. She's going to take his findings to an information broker, I'm sure. He'll never work again."
"Sila has a new stock of exotic components. She says they can enhance spells in a way other components cannot."
table.name: Rumors—Precinct Five

table.caption: People on the Street—Precinct Six
rows: Carpenter, heading to the next job
Devkarin elf (dark elf), on an errand
Goblin cutpurse, looking for an easy mark
Laborer, ready to head to the tavern
Merchant, looking for a {@creature Rakdos|GGR} club
Metalsmith, grimy from a long day's work
Soldier, off duty and enjoying a walk
Soldier, on duty and in a hurry
table.name: People on the Street—Precinct Six

table.caption: Rumors—Precinct Six
rows: "Something very large was lurking in the chasm last night, and it knocked a carriage off a bridge. The passengers jumped out just in time!"
"I heard that Krenko's gang has been trying to get their hands on mizzium, and are willing to pay a good price for it too."
"The wight of Precinct Six has struck again! This morning, an arrester and a cutpurse were found dead in an alley, drained of their life. A bystander saw it happen."
"Did you hear those shrieking sounds out near Benzer's Bridge last night? Whatever it was, it didn't sound like anything I've ever heard before. Chilling."
"I hear Rhionna is closing up her forge. She says she's getting sick of replacing stolen tools every week. The staff claims they're innocent."
"One of the warehouses out in Medori Park had an intense red glow shining through its windows yesterday. Smelled of sulfur. No one wants to go near it."
table.name: Rumors—Precinct Six

table.caption: Guild Location Goals
rows: Prevent a magical catastrophe inside the location.
Find the source of strange occurrences in or near the location.
Escape the location (and help others escape) when a disaster occurs inside.
Quell a riot inside or around the location.
Kill or drive out a monster that has turned the location into its lair.
Defend the location against an external attacker.
Infiltrate the location and report on what's happening inside.
table.name: Guild Locations; Guild Location Goals

table.caption: Location Connections
rows: Transport a person, an object, or information collected at the first location safely to the second.
Plant something taken from the first location inside the second to incriminate someone in the second location.
Do the same thing at the second location as was done at the first.
Uncover the source of interference encountered at the first location, which lies in the second.
Follow a fleeing foe or trail a suspicious figure from the first location to the second.
Follow up on information gained at the first location by investigating the second.
table.name: Linked Locations; Location Connections

table.caption: Guild Villains
rows: A villain is attempting to disgrace or discredit a powerful person.
A villain is striving for power within their guild.
A villain has claimed power in their guild and needs to be supplanted.
The villain is sending agents to infiltrate one or more guilds.
The villain's agents are luring members away from another guild.
The villain's agents are sabotaging the operations of another guild.
table.name: Guild Villains

table.caption: Guild Character Objectives
rows: Find an item that is important to the guild.
Get information from a guild member.
Protect or rescue a guild member in the midst of a catastrophe.
Free a guild member from captivity.
Kill or capture an enemy of the guild.
Help a guild member who's in trouble with the law.
Recruit someone to join the guild.
table.name: Guild Character Objectives

table.caption: Cross Purposes
rows: ... directly target one or more characters. The adventure begins when characters are attacked by the villain's agents.
... threaten a character's contact or bond.
... challenge a character's ideal or exploit a flaw. The character might hear rumors of this activity, spurring them into action.
... open an opportunity for a character to pursue a personal goal.
... compete with a character's guild. A guild authority might order the character to rectify the situation.
... open an opportunity for a guild to pursue its own agenda.
... catch the characters between fighting forces.
... cause an accident or catastrophe that traps the characters.
table.name: Involving the Characters; Cross Purposes

table.caption: Secondary Guild Role
rows: A rival pursues the same goal as the adventurers, but is doing it "wrong."
One or more members of another guild are caught between the villain and the adventurers.
A group of NPC adventurers from another guild confront the same villain for different reasons.
Someone is manipulating the villain for their own purposes.
A known rival or enemy meddles in the adventure, hoping the adventurers will fail.
A known rival or enemy can provide essential help in stopping the villain.
A second villain's plot is unfolding at the same time but is otherwise unrelated.
A second villain is in competition with the first one.
table.name: Complications; Secondary Guild Role

table.caption: Guild Intrigue
rows: Guilds are vying for influence over a prominent individual (who might be a player character).
Guilds are competing for control of a key site or swath of territory.
Guilds are locked in a deadly feud but might be open to a peace negotiation.
Villains from two or more guilds are forming a dangerous alliance.
A villain is trying to disrupt an alliance between two or more guilds.
Splinter factions from two guilds are trying to form a new guild.
table.name: Guild Intrigue

table.caption: Arrester Station Adventures
rows: Break out of the holding cells.
Break someone else out of the holding cells.
Stop someone before they can give information to the arresters or testify before a judge.
Get information from or to someone in the holding cells.
Apprehend a former prisoner who used magic to take over the station and drive the guards away.
Find proof that the captain of this station is corrupt.
Discover who helped a prisoner escape and how.
Uncover a plot to discredit, blackmail, or kill the station commander.
Steal the arresters' files about a criminal or a case.
Intercept a message being sent to or from the station.
table.name: Arrester Station Adventures

table.caption: Azorius Villains
rows: An ambitious authority figure seeks to achieve a higher rank by framing or defaming a rival.
A venal judge's rulings are swayed by bribes and favors.
A vengeful imperator persecutes a certain group of people, seeking revenge for a past wrong done by one of the group's members.
An overzealous imperator is prepared to arrest a neighborhood full of people to find a stolen item.
A sadistic warden tortures prisoners, ostensibly for the sake of law and order.
A corrupt senator seeks to pass laws that favor a certain class of people.
A {@creature precognitive mage|GGR} invents visions designed to frame enemies.
A cowardly bureaucrat destroys evidence to hide someone else's involvement in a crime.
table.name: Azorius Villains

table.caption: Azorius Assignments
rows: Find and arrest a wanted fugitive.
Arrest someone identified as a potential criminal by precognitive mages.
Clear the name of an innocent person.
Solve a murder by questioning suspects.
table.name: Azorius Character Goals; Azorius Assignments

table.caption: Azorius Adventure Hooks
rows: A {@creature precognitive mage|GGR} has identified the characters as future criminals, and now there's a warrant out for their arrest.
A {@creature precognitive mage|GGR} has foreseen the characters' future struggles and tries to protect them, thereby interfering in their next adventure.
{@creature Felidar|GGR|Felidars} have bonded with the wrong person and now track an innocent citizen.
Hussars—Azorius {@creature Soldier|GGR|soldiers}  mounted on {@creature Griffon||griffons}—declare martial law in a neighborhood and enforce their harsh authority on the citizenry.
An {@creature archon of the Triumvirate|GGR} interprets innocent actions as illegal ones because its connection to the law has been corrupted.
A missing {@creature homunculus} is the sole witness to the murder of a judge.
table.name: Other Adventure Hooks; Azorius Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Legion Garrison Adventures
rows: Break a siege at the garrison.
Sabotage the building's defenses so someone else can break into the garrison.
Find a hidden explosive charge in the garrison before it detonates.
Steal a magic weapon held inside the garrison.
Discover evidence that incriminates an officer in the garrison.
Identify a spy among the garrison's soldiers before the spy can escape.
Help a spy get safely out of the garrison without being discovered.
Capture a garrison officer for interrogation.
Shore up the garrison's defenses before an assault.
Clear out the monsters infesting a garrison that was abandoned years ago.
Steal plans for future Boros military action.
table.name: Legion Garrison Adventures

table.caption: Boros Villains
rows: Seeking to avenge a partner's murder, a Wojek League officer turns to vigilantism.
A Boros commander starts preemptively closing Izzet foundries, Simic research chambers, and other locations considered prone to disaster.
Angered at the death of a loved one in a certain neighborhood, a Wojek agent is inciting its residents to revolt, knowing that the Boros will respond with force.
Believing that they are harboring terrorists, a Boros brigadier is slaughtering helpless people in transient communities in the undercity.
A squad of corrupt Boros {@creature Soldier|GGR|soldiers}  is extorting money from local merchants.
A Boros commander under the thumb of another guild is turning a blind eye to the violence perpetrated by that guild.
An overzealous angel has risen up against innocent people, including the soldiers in her own garrison, believing that they harbor evil in their hearts.
A crazed angel demands to be worshiped as a god.
table.name: Boros Villains

table.caption: Boros Assignments
rows: Help quell a {@creature Rakdos|GGR} riot or hold back Gruul raiders, or otherwise maintain the peace while protecting innocent bystanders.
Capture or kill a Gruul chieftain who has taken responsibility for a series of brutal raids.
Help evacuate citizens from the area of a natural or magical disaster.
Escort an important person safely from one place to another.
Investigate a Boros commander suspected of cultivating personal loyalty in underlings, rather than loyalty to the legion.
Uncover a spy in the legion.
table.name: Boros Character Goals; Boros Assignments

table.caption: Boros Adventure Hooks
rows: A Boros officer is awaiting trial for unsanctioned and excessive use of force, and the officer's squad is planning a jailbreak.
The Boros are secretly working with the Shattergang Brothers, a group of black market arms dealers, to develop a devastating weapon.
A Boros offensive is displacing and even killing innocent bystanders caught in its path.
Flame-kin soldiers created as part of an abandoned weapons project are suddenly reactivated and run amok. These soldiers use the {@creature azer} stat block in the {@book Monster Manual|MM}.
A Boros parade meant as a show of strength provokes widespread protests, some of which erupt into violence.
A flying Boros fortress is about to crash, threatening to devastate the neighborhood below.
table.name: Other Adventure Hooks; Boros Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Safe House Adventures
rows: Find a fugitive hiding in the safe house.
Liberate someone being held in the safe house.
Get information from a prisoner in the safe house without revealing that information to the Dimir.
Acquire information from a Dimir agent to unmask a spy embedded in another guild.
Escape from captivity in the safe house.
Plant a magical surveillance device inside the safe house.
Damage or destroy the safe house so the Dimir can't use it anymore.

Prevent the creation of a horror (a {@creature flying horror|ggr}, {@creature shadow horror|ggr}, or a {@creature skittering horror|ggr}) in the safe house. (You can replace the horror with a different creature from the {@book Monster Manual|MM}.)
Find and kill a {@creature mind drinker vampire|GGR} or other monster that is picking off the safe house's inhabitants.
Disable the safe house's wards and plant a beacon inside it so that members of another guild can find and raid the place.
After stumbling into the safe house accidentally, get out with memories intact.
table.name: Safe House Adventures

table.caption: Dimir Villains
rows: A spy seeks to plunder another guild's secrets.
A {@creature mind mage|GGR} is hunting down everyone who witnessed a great humiliation to expunge their memories of the event.
A {@creature mind mage|GGR} has implanted false memories of a crime in many minds in order to incriminate someone.
A group of Dimir agents is plundering the minds of people who have knowledge of a vault that holds great wealth or magical power.
After a Dimir spy is unmasked, a {@creature mind mage|GGR} erases the memory of the spy's identity from the minds of those involved.
A shapeshifter has replaced a high-ranking member of another guild in order to provoke conflicts.
A {@creature mind drinker vampire|GGR} is plundering the minds of its victims.
Roll on another guild's villain table, but the villain is a disguised Dimir agent or someone being manipulated by the Dimir.
table.name: Dimir Villains

table.caption: Dimir Assignments
rows: Impersonate an individual to gather information from that individual's contacts and associates.
Make sure that a particular person (not a main antagonist) at an adventure site doesn't survive the encounter with the characters.
Make sure that a particular person (not the main villain) survives the adventure.
Get information from the main villain by magically extracting the villain's dying thoughts.
Plant evidence to steer the other adventurers away from the true villain.
Get information to a Dimir agent who is embedded in the adventure location.
table.name: Dimir Character Goals; Dimir Assignments

table.caption: Dimir Adventure Hooks
rows: The characters find a bundle of {@i thought strands}, and Dimir agents are in a rush to find them before they fade away.
A rogue agent hunted by Dimir assassins offers crippling information about House Dimir in exchange for protection.
A Dimir horror (a {@creature flying horror|ggr}, {@creature shadow horror|ggr}, or a {@creature skittering horror|ggr}) is randomly killing people in the dark alleys of a particular neighborhood.
Word is out that someone claims to have a list of Dimir agents embedded in other guilds, igniting a furious contest to obtain the list.
While prying too deeply into ancient lore, a Dimir agent (now deceased) released a nameless evil into the city.
Roll on another guild's adventure hooks table, but the Dimir are secretly behind the situation.
table.name: Other Adventure Hooks; Dimir Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Undercity Mansion Adventures
rows: Find the source of a noxious fog rising from the undercity and poisoning a surface neighborhood.
Rescue several citizens being held hostage by Ochran agents.
Find the daytime lair of an elusive monster that hunts on the surface at night.
Rescue a guild member {@condition petrified} by an {@creature undercity medusa|GGR} that uses the mansion as its lair.
Take shelter in the mansion to escape a horrible monster prowling the undercity.
Win a bet by surviving a night inside.
Find and claim a treasure hidden in the mansion.
Attend a masked ball held in the mansion in order to get information from another guest.
table.name: Undercity Mansion Adventures

table.caption: Golgari Villains
rows: Armed with a powerful magic item found among the dead in the undercity, a {@creature Golgari shaman|GGR} enacts a plan of revenge against another guild.
A {@creature kraul death priest|GGR} is seeking a way to revive the ancient gods of Ravnica and destroy the world.
A {@creature Devkarin lich|GGR} is capturing living subjects and infecting them with an insidious, mind-controlling fungus.
A trophy-hunting {@creature undercity medusa|GGR} for the stat block) is on a killing spree, petrifying victims in interesting poses.
A {@creature Golgari shaman|GGR} is spreading a fungal infection that transforms its dead victims into {@creature Zombie||zombies}.
An elf child lures citizens into the sewers, where a monstrous "pet" is waiting to kill and eat them.
Pursuing a personal vendetta, an Ochran {@creature assassin} is targeting members of a certain guild and trying to ensure that their bodies are never found.

A {@creature kraul death priest|GGR}, angry at the way the Golgari have treated the kraul in the past, is killing the elves and medusas of the guild, hoping to eventually take Jarad's place as guildmaster.
table.name: Golgari Villains

table.caption: Golgari Assignments
rows: Find a valuable item believed lost in the undercity.
Retrieve a corpse in the undercity.
Collect a sample of a fungus in the undercity.
Steal something that is important to another guild.
Kill an outspoken enemy of the Golgari.
Position a fungus so that its spores will spread into a populated area and drive the inhabitants out.
table.name: Golgari Character Goals; Golgari Assignments

table.caption: Golgari Adventure Hooks
rows: Citizens who die in a particular neighborhood sprout fungal growths and rise as {@creature Zombie||zombies}, then shamble toward the undercity.
{@creature Swarm of Insects||Swarms of insects} under the control of a {@creature Golgari shaman|GGR} terrorize a neighborhood.
Poor people who subsist on Golgari food contract a dangerous, contagious magical infection.
Several kraul have moved into an old tenement and are making their neighbors nervous.
A beloved statue, long assumed to be the image of some forgotten community hero, suddenly returns to life after being {@condition petrified} for a hundred years.
table.name: Other Adventure Hooks; Golgari Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Rubblebelt Encampment Adventures
rows: Determine why the Gruul have camped so close to a settled neighborhood.
Free a captive taken in a recent raid.
Win freedom by defeating a Gruul champion in a duel.
Retrieve something looted in a recent raid.
Strike a deal with the Gruul leader to cooperate against a common foe.
Attempt to overthrow the clan chieftain in a combat challenge.
Strike a blow to the Gruul to ensure that they don't launch a raid.
Free a corralled herd of violent beasts so they stampede through the Gruul camp before the Gruul can steer them toward settled areas.
Interrupt a ritual intended to summon or create a huge elemental.
Disrupt a gathering of clans that could lead to an alliance between them.
table.name: Rubblebelt Encampment Adventures

table.caption: Gruul Villains
rows: A {@creature druid of the Old Ways|GGR}, spurred by visions of the end of civilization, plans humanoid sacrifices in the name of Ilharg the Raze-Boar.
A druid is directing herds of beasts to run amok through tenement neighborhoods.
A druid summons huge vines and roots to tear buildings down.
A clan chieftain leads a raid to settle a personal vendetta against another guild.
In a display of strength, a clan chieftain seeks to destroy a significant landmark.
Looking for a totem of spiritual significance, a clanless giant wrecks anything in its path.
Hoping to form a new clan, a clever centaur tries to break violent criminals out of jail.
A druid leads a band that has begun starting fires around the district.
table.name: Gruul Villains

table.caption: Gruul Assignments
rows: Collect a beast cub so it can be trained for battle.
Slay a powerful monster to prove your strength.
Destroy a laboratory, a work of engineering, or a similar edifice of decadent civilization.
Kill someone who has been persecuting the Gruul.
Free a captive warrior who was imprisoned during a recent raid.
Create a disruption so the clan can raid elsewhere.
table.name: Gruul Character Goals; Gruul Assignments

table.caption: Gruul Adventure Hooks
rows: Conflict between two feuding clans spills onto the streets of the city, threatening to destroy entire neighborhoods.
Gruul {@creature Anarch|GGR|anarchs} deface or destroy monuments throughout the district.
A Gruul mob riots in the streets in observance of Rauck-Chauv, a holiday celebrated with violence.
A {@creature wurm|GGR} breaks free of its Gruul controller and goes on a rampage.
Swine everywhere run wild, and the Gruul interpret this as a sign of the Raze-Boar's return.
Gruul raiders steal something from an Izzet laboratory that will cause a disaster if it isn't returned.
table.name: Other Adventure Hooks; Gruul Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Experimental Workshop Adventures
rows: Rescue people trapped in the workshop after a disaster.
Steal plans or a prototype for a new weapon.
Stop the spread of toxic gas or molten mizzium from inside the workshop.
Shut down the operation of a dangerous device.

Capture or kill an elemental or an Izzet weird (a {@creature blistercoil weird|ggr} or {@creature galvanice weird|ggr}) that is running amok in the workshop, and make sure it doesn't escape out into the city.
Get out of the workshop before it is destroyed by a spreading catastrophe.
Destroy the workshop in order to obliterate the research being done there.
Destroy the workshop in order to bring down a different building nearby.
Find a saboteur in the workshop before the traitor's plans can be enacted.
Kill an inventor whose ideas are too dangerous to be put into practice.
Activate an invention being held in storage in the workshop.
table.name: Experimental Workshop Adventures

table.caption: Bizarre Magical Effects
rows: Every spell cast in the area triggers a wild magic surge. (Roll on the {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB} table in the "Sorcerer" section of the {@i Player's Handbook}.)
One or more objects in the area have a random trick effect. (Roll on the Tricks table in {@book appendix A|DMG|10|Random Tricks} of the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}.)
The area is affected by a {@spell guards and wards}{@i  spell}.
Rooms and chambers in the area are affected by random obstacles. (Roll on the Obstacles table in {@book appendix A|DMG|10|Stocking a Dungeon} of the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}.)
One or more objects in the area have a random trap effect. (Roll on the Traps table in {@book appendix A|DMG|10|Random Traps} of the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}.)
Random sections of the area are affected by an {@spell antimagic field} spell.
table.name: Experimental Workshop Map; Bizarre Magical Effects

table.caption: Izzet Villains
rows: A disgraced member of the Izmundi tries to embarrass the guild by orchestrating a magical disaster.
A team of inventors is creating a secret arsenal of volatile weapons.
Trying to impress the guildmaster, a mage from the Laboratory of Storms and Electricity creates a device that pushes the weather from one extreme to another.
A researcher siphons power from the Blistercoils to fuel experiments, causing failures in parts of the city's infrastructure.
An obsessive researcher, trying to perfect an alchemical formula, causes a series of ever-worsening laboratory mishaps.
A guild leader orchestrates a series of "accidental" laboratory explosions that are actually meant to disrupt the nearby activities of other guilds.
An imprisoned spellcaster stages an explosive prison break using improvised materials.
A suspicious spellcaster who can't trust research secrets to others creates clones that run amok.
table.name: Izzet Villains

table.caption: Izzet Assignments
rows: Acquire a hard-to-find metal or energy source.
Take measurements of an unusual object or location (such as spatial dimensions or readings of various magical levels).
Repair an important piece of Ravnica's infrastructure, such as a water main or a boiler pipe, that is tucked away in a remote location.
table.name: Izzet Character Goals; Izzet Assignments

table.caption: Izzet Adventure Hooks
rows: An Izzet experiment transforms a researcher, who then seeks help in returning to normal form.
An escaped Izzet weird (a {@creature blistercoil weird|ggr} or {@creature galvanice weird|ggr}) is causing magical malfunctions around the district.
A researcher trying to craft an antigravity alloy for a personal flight apparatus has created a number of {@spell reverse gravity} effects, and is now trapped in midair at the top of one.
After a laboratory explosion, an alchemical fire resistant to conventional firefighting techniques is spreading through several neighborhoods.
A reckless researcher triggered an explosion in a mizzium foundry, causing a wave of molten metal to spill out into the surrounding streets.
A researcher who claims to have traveled back in time warns of an impending disaster.
table.name: Other Adventure Hooks; Izzet Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Grand Basilica Adventures
rows: Steal (or recover) a magic item from the vaults below the basilica.
Put an end to nightly visitations by finding and confronting the haunting spirit in the basilica.
Survive a night trapped inside the basilica.
Deliver a warning to an Orzhov pontiff in the basilica and get out alive.
Rescue a prisoner being held in the basilica's spire or crypts.
Escape from captivity in the basilica's spire or crypts.
Destroy a dangerous weapon stored in a vault beneath the basilica.
Acquire or destroy some incriminating evidence held by an Orzhov blackmailer.
Retrieve a precious item held as collateral by an Orzhov loan shark.
Get information from a spirit who knew something important in life.
Find concrete evidence of the syndicate's illegal activities.
Discover the fate of someone who was last seen entering the basilica a week ago.
table.name: Grand Basilica Adventures

table.caption: Orzhov Villains
rows: A powerful pontiff is using the spirits of dead relatives to intimidate members of other guilds.
An angel defected from the Boros Legion, bringing a magic sword with her that the Boros want back.
An Orzhov knight is trying to collect an overdue debt incurred by one of the adventurers' ancestors.
A pontiff is running an extortion racket, promising local businesses protection from thugs that are also in the Orzhov's employ.
A {@creature blood drinker vampire|GGR} is holding prisoners as a food supply in a bank vault.
An advokist is exploiting legal loopholes to win the freedom of several criminals from Azorius prisons.
A desperate spirit tries to frighten people into paying its debts so it can pass on.
An unusually quick-witted {@creature Orzhov giant|GGR} for the stat block) with grand visions of starting a criminal gang interferes with the flow of protection money.
table.name: Orzhov Villains

table.caption: Orzhov Assignments
rows: Convince a debtor to make a payment.
Damage the person or property of someone who refuses to pay protection money.
Transport a chest of coins to an Orzhov bank.
Destroy evidence that implicates the Orzhov in a crime.
Find information that can be used to blackmail a powerful person.
table.name: Orzhov Character Goals; Orzhov Assignments

table.caption: Orzhov Adventure Hooks
rows: Newly minted Orzhov coins are inscribed with a magical symbol that binds the spirit of anyone who uses them.
{@creature Indentured Spirit|GGR|Indentured spirits} have been deployed to haunt a location the Orzhov want to keep people away from.
Thrulls (a {@creature servitor thrull|ggr} or {@creature winged thrull|ggr}) that have broken free of Orzhov control are causing mischief.
Items appear on the black market that were obviously stolen from an Orzhov vault, but no one admits that the theft has occurred or claims credit.
{@creature Gargoyle||Gargoyles} perched on structures throughout the city are robbing passersby and delivering their stolen goods to an Orzhov basilica.
An eclipse triggers violent behavior from bound Orzhov spirits.
table.name: Other Adventure Hooks; Orzhov Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Notorious Nightclub Adventures
rows: Shut down a performance before the performers start attacking the crowd.
Escape from the club once the violence starts.
Protect a thrill seeker who wants to witness a performance close up.
Rescue someone who has been abducted for use as an extra in a show.
Find evidence that someone important was (or was not) killed in a previous performance here.
Capture a performer who ran away from a prominent family to "join the circus."
Use the distraction of a performance to hold a secret meeting with someone from another guild.
Spy on someone who is using the distraction of a performance to hold a secret meeting.
Acquire a magic item the {@creature Rakdos|GGR} are using as part of a performance.
Investigate rumors that the {@creature Rakdos|GGR} have a wingless angel in their show.
Find an escaped convict who is rumored to be hiding behind {@creature Rakdos|GGR} makeup.
Stop a {@creature Rakdos|GGR} member who is blackmailing an important person with embarrassing information.
table.name: Notorious Nightclub Adventures

table.caption: Rakdos Villains
rows: A coven of {@creature Blood Witch|GGR|blood witches}, seeking {@creature Rakdos|GGR}'s favor, uses magic to turn members of other guilds against their own allies.
Word spreads that a retiring performer wants to go out with a bang, and their final performance promises to be explosive.
Mocking the absence of the Guildpact, a {@creature Rakdos|GGR} troupe takes over the Chamber of the Guildpact and performs its satire before a captive audience.
A demon captures people and makes a game of thwarting their efforts to escape.
A skilled puppeteer uses skeletal marionettes to recreate historical acts of violence between guilds—which are inexplicably repeated in the real world within the next few days.
A ringmaster has discovered magic that fills the whole audience with blood lust and sends them rampaging through the streets.
A hypnotist is programming audience members to go into a murderous rage when a triggering event occurs.
A crazed {@creature blood witch|GGR} hopes to rouse {@creature Rakdos|GGR} by driving captured sacrificial victims into his lair.
table.name: Rakdos Villains

table.caption: Rakdos Assignments
rows: Acquire a flashy magic item to use as a prop in a performance.
Try out a new performance routine in the midst of actual life-or-death combat.
Sow distrust of an important person through satire or slander.
Make sure a specific person is in the front row for a certain performance.
Capture a deadly monster for use in a spectacular show.
Interrupt a solemn ceremony or ritual being performed by another guild.
table.name: Rakdos Character Goals; Rakdos Assignments

table.caption: Rakdos Adventure Hooks
rows: Wild-eyed people attending a popular new club seem unwilling or unable to go home after several days of nonstop merriment.
One morning, everyone who has seen a {@creature Rakdos|GGR} performance in the past week suddenly transforms into a minor demon.
An apparently spontaneous {@creature Rakdos|GGR}-led riot has spread to take over an entire neighborhood.
People who die in {@creature Rakdos|GGR}-inspired violence stand back up as {@creature Zombie||zombies} and keep fighting.
Ordinary knives and chains in homes across the neighborhood seem to come to life in advance of the start of a {@creature Rakdos|GGR} show.
After several mausoleums are burst open from the inside, people see their undead family members cavorting on a {@creature Rakdos|GGR} stage.
table.name: Other Adventure Hooks; Rakdos Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Vernadi Center Adventures

Find the source of pollen that is drifting through the neighborhood and making people placid and compliant.
Find the source of wind-borne seeds that are drifting through the neighborhood and quickly growing into hostile awakened shrubs.
Retrieve an initiate who was supposedly forced to join the guild through mind-affecting magic.
Stop the vernadi, whose tree has awakened and escaped the control of its dryad, from trampling through the neighborhood.
Find a way to tap into the mind, will, and knowledge of Mat'Selesnya through the vernadi's central tree or its dryad.
Introduce a contagion into Mat'Selesnya through the vernadi's tree or its dryad.
Capture an equenaut who has been accused of a crime and who has taken refuge at the vernadi.
Convince or coerce a healer to tend to a sick or wounded person who would normally be an enemy of the conclave.
Find a spy embedded in the vernadi community.
Blend into the community to avoid pursuers.
Retrieve an item that was donated to the community by a new initiate, but without the permission of the item's owner.

A voda, feeling imperiled by the ills of society, causes vines to grow and seal the members of her vernadi inside.
A militant leader of a splinter group harasses "unbelievers" on the street and threatens to unleash elemental power on them.
A loxodon evangel uses coercive methods to recruit young people into the conclave.
An elf seeking spiritual union with Mat'Selesnya threatens the dryad of their own vernadi.
A crazed prophet claims to be the incarnation of Mat'Selesnya and gathers an army to strike at other guilds.
A {@creature horncaller|GGR} steals animals that were used as pets, mounts, and beasts of burden throughout the neighborhood.
table.name: Selesnya Villains

table.caption: Selesnya Assignments
rows: Work to stop the spread of a strange illness.
Tend to the victims of a catastrophe or an attack.
Mediate a dispute between two other guilds.
Plant a magic seed, watch it grow into a great tree, and defend the tree until reinforcements arrive.
Bring an unruly beast under control and return it to the vernadi it escaped from.
Lead a targeted military strike to warn another guild against overreaching.
table.name: Selesnya Character Goals; Selesnya Assignments

table.caption: Selesnya Adventure Hooks
rows: A sacred tree has been defiled or cut down, and an angry Selesnya mob is gathering to exact revenge.
The Worldsoul has identified the characters as emblematic of their guilds' overreaching ambition.
A seer of the conclave tries to convince the characters that they are fated to save the world.
Plants throughout a neighborhood develop carnivorous tendencies.
A magic-infused stone of a Selesnya building grows out of control, threatening nearby buildings.
A Selesnya {@creature wurm|GGR} breaks free of its controller and goes on a rampage.
table.name: Other Adventure Hooks; Selesnya Adventure Hooks

Break one or more krasis out of their growth pods in order to wreak havoc on the growth chamber.
Stop a sinister experiment in progress.
Spy on a research program intended to create superior soldiers.
Subtly sabotage a research program so that it fails without the interference being obvious.
Steal research notes from an experiment with broad applications.

Researchers team up to surround an entire neighborhood in a plasma casing that is slowly altering the environment and all its inhabitants.
A magic-wielding Simic hybrid is eluding capture by the authorities thanks to a combination of adaptations and spells.
A researcher delves too deep into ancient lore and discovers mind-warping alien secrets.
A researcher creates a moss that threatens to destroy much of the city's food production.
A {@creature biomancer|GGR} seeks revenge by creating a specialized krasis that targets a specific guild.

Introduce a new predator species to the area to prey on a smaller species that is running amok.

A Simic airship falls to the ground, and it contains key research that several parties want to acquire.
A sage of the Gyre Clade accidentally creates an {@spell antimagic field} that slowly spreads over the neighborhood.
People and animals near a Simic zonot develop spontaneous mutations.

table.caption: Headquarters Locations
rows: Een taveerne die ooit eigendom was van smokkelaars. De tunnelingangen zijn duidelijk dichtgemetseld, en niemand weet waar ze naartoe leiden.
Een eenvoudige kapel voor een lang vergeten god. De banken zijn erg ongemakkelijk, maar er brandt geurige wierook zonder ophouden.
Een door de strijd versleten kasteel. Een echte opknapper, het heeft betere dagen gekend. Betere jaren. Misschien zelfs betere eeuwen.
Een top marineschip dat op een of andere manier is gestrand, kilometers landinwaarts.
Een privé-bibliotheek. De franchise is vrij om de ruimte te gebruiken zolang er geen schade aan de boeken wordt toegebracht.
Een uitgehold standbeeld van een oude koning.
Een vroeg model luchtschip. Heel vroeg. De ballon bestaat nu vooral uit lapjes - een bonte verzameling scheepszeilen, mantels en dierenhuiden.
Een voormalige smederij, wat een voormalige oefenstudio was, en daarvoor een voormalig café.
Een veelkleurig waterdicht doek gespannen over een opeenvolging van uitstekende stenen zuilen. Binnen lijkt het altijd laat voorjaar te zijn.
Een krakende wagen die naar rapen ruikt, en die van binnen groter is dan van buiten.
table.name: Fast Franchise Generator; Headquarters Locations

table.caption: Headquarters Quirks
rows: Eén trap leidt op de een of andere manier naar twee verschillende plaatsen.
Elke ketel die in de keuken wordt gebruikt, schreeuwt als hij kookt.
Elke stoel heeft één been dat iets korter is dan de andere.
Elke trap heeft de illusie van een extra trede bovenaan.
Er zit een nest op zolder. Een groot nest. Zoals, echt groot.
Elke vrijdag verandert de kleur van de muren in een ander feestelijk thema.
Het gebouw was vroeger eigendom van een franchise concurrent, en het staat vol met hun marketing materiaal.
Er is een ruimte in het hoofdkwartier die duidelijk een kamer is, maar die geen deuren heeft.
table.name: Fast Franchise Generator; Headquarters Quirks

Een sinister figuur die in de schaduw blijft en altijd op verzoeken antwoordt met, "Ja, meester."
De geest van de vorige eigenaar. Ze doen verschrikkelijk werk en verwijzen naar alle potentiële klanten als indringers.
Een bruuske, dove, gepensioneerde militaire kapitein.
Een ongelooflijk vrolijke chef, die volhoudt dat geen zaak dringender is dan een volle buik.
Een druïde die een open deur beleid heeft voor alle dieren die onderdak zoeken. Hun schoonmaakbeleid is minder streng.
table.name: Fast Franchise Generator; Memorable Majordomos

{@b Jeremy Snoot}: De gemakkelijkst te intimideren douanebeambte in de stad. Van blauwdrukken van overheidsgebouwen tot scheepsformulieren, hij is je halfling.
{@b York Battleby}: Hij kan goed breien en met een zwaard zwaaien. Hij neemt betaling in drank aan voor beide diensten.
{@b Diana Fenwick}: Edelachtbare die crimineel wil spelen; enthousiast, onervaren, en geladen.
{@b "G"}: Het enige wat bekend is over deze informatiemakelaar is het dode punt waar ze berichten uitwisselen, en dat ze het nooit mis hebben.
{@b Teresa Clearlake}: Als je op zoek bent naar een plek om onder te duiken, haar begrafenisonderneming is ideaal.
{@b Jenkin Twotooth}: Heeft altijd werk voor wie een paar munten bij elkaar wil schrapen. Helaas heeft hij meer tanden dan scrupules.

{@b "Mustard" Micah}: Beroemd omdat hij goederen en mensen langs elke blokkade kan krijgen. Op voorwaarde dat je het niet erg vindt dat die goederen en mensen de komende maand sterk naar mosterd ruiken.

table.caption: Why Be a Cartographer?
rows: Je bent van nature paranoïde en je wilt altijd zien wat er voor je ligt.
Jouw ouder was een cartograaf, hun ouder was een cartograaf, en bij de goden, jij gaat het ook worden.
Je bent er vrij zeker van dat niemand anders in je groep weet hoe je een kaart vast moet houden, laat staan lezen.
Je houdt van verrekijkers. Heel veel.
Je bijnaam als kind was "het cartografie kind."
In tegenstelling tot wat velen denken, is de bestemming veel, veel belangrijker dan de reis.
Een goede kaart is als een avontuur zonder de insecten. En de modder. En de wolven.
U lijdt aan het knagende gevoel nooit te weten waarom u in een kamer bent gekomen, en u hebt de professionele opsmuk nodig waarmee u dat kunt verdoezelen.
table.name: Why Be a Cartographer?

table.caption: Coin of Decisionry "Tails" Image
rows: Een veertienkoppige hydra (het is een grote munt)
Een oude despotische tiran, hun beeld ontsiert
table.name: Proficiencies and Starting Equipment; Coin of Decisionry "Tails" Image

table.caption: Why Be a Decisionist?
rows: Jij bent het altijd die kiest waar iedereen luncht.
Ruwweg de helft van je keuzes zijn de juiste. Je kunt er net zo goed een muntje voor opgooien.
Je hebt geen idee. In feite, je wordt constant geplaagd door besluiteloosheid.
Democratie is de grootste kracht voor verandering in de wereld, maar wordt verpest doordat iedereen stemt.
Je hebt altijd gevoeld dat het jouw roeping was om andere mensen te vertellen wat ze moeten doen. Nu om het officieel te maken.
Als je voor twee keuzes staat, heb je altijd verlangd naar de vrijheid om beide te kiezen.
Als kind moest je van een broer of zus kiezen welk speelgoed bleef leven of stierf. Je was nooit meer dezelfde.
table.name: Why Be a Decisionist?

rows: Zoals je wilt, op voorwaarde dat je eerst een kopie maakt
Het bodemloze gat in de kelder, althans, je bent er vrij zeker van dat het bodemloos is.
Ik voer het aan de geit buiten.
Je collega's het laten eten door het stukje voor stukje in hun eten te stoppen... de enige manier om zeker te zijn...

table.caption: Why Be a Documancer?
rows: Je hebt ooit een gerucht gehoord dat een contract tekenen met je linkerhand technisch niet bindend is, en je bent wanhopig om te zien of het waar is. Voor redenen.
Alle bedrijven hebben hun ups en downs, maar er is altijd geld te verdienen met "verwerkingskosten".
U hebt de gewoonte altijd duidelijk te zijn over wat u hebt beloofd, maar nooit te zeggen wanneer u het zult doen.
Je houdt van decoratief krulwerk op documenten, wetende dat dat de beste plaats is om de kleine lettertjes te verbergen.
Als kind leerde je om je vingers achter je rug te kruisen als je iets beloofde. Nu verlang je ernaar om dat wettelijk bindend te maken.
Je gewoonte om te schreeuwen, "No take backs!" na elke groepsbeslissing leek te wijzen op je ware roeping.
U gelooft dat taal een kunst is, geen wetenschap. Wie zal zeggen wat wel of niet een "echt" woord is?
De geur van oud perkament maakt je duizelig.
table.name: Why Be a Documancer?

Gemaakt van natuurlijke, organische, lokaal geproduceerde geweven vezels
Een dikke, door de strijd gehavende ijzeren slotkast
Een metalen kast met fijne gravure en krulwerk
Een gehavende lederen tas, die vaak veelkleurige vonken uit de naden spuwt.

Een zakformaat verborgen in je mouw of in je hoed
